page.title: 02Life Styles
page.content: Seamer is an old village,made up of Seamer,Irton and Crossgates.The population today is about 3400 and since 1945 it has tripled.A lot of the old residents still live here and many people come here to retire.Most of them worked on the land,but people moved into the area and developed local industries.There is an old peoples community centre now,and trips and fun competitions are organised for them.Seamer means"mere by the sea" _ there used to be a lake going through Seamer,but now there is just an under ground,artesian lake near Irton.There aren't many shops,only two and a chip shop.There have been new building estates since 1960.Park Estate was the first and Eastgate,Crab Lane and Stableton Close followed.In 1961 a war memorial hall was built,and Seamer is only just getting a doctors surgery.
